3.speaker: POLAR BEAR
3.japanese: 新メニューのホットケーキ　味見してみて
3.english: These pancakes are a new menu item. Try them out.

4.speaker: PANDA
4.english: There's no bamboo grass in it.

6.speaker: PANDA
6.japanese: なんか　しょっぱい

7.speaker: POLAR BEAR
7.english: I tried putting salmon in it.

8.speaker: POLAR BEAR
8.japanese: 笹子さんも食べてみてよ
8.english: You should try it, too, Miss Sasako.

10.speaker: SASAKO
10.japanese: やっぱり　しょっぱいです

11.speaker: PANDA
11.japanese: あれ？ ペンギンさんいつからいたの？
11.english: Oh, when did you get here, Mr. Penguin?

12.speaker: PENGUIN
12.english: I've been here the whole time!

13.speaker: POLAR BEAR
13.japanese: ちゃんと気づいてたよ
13.english: I noticed, but I wasn't sure if I should talk to you.

15.speaker: POLAR BEAR
15.japanese: シャケ入りホットケーキ　食べる？
15.english: Would you like some salmon pancakes?

16.speaker: PENGUIN
16.japanese: 僕は今食欲なんかないの
16.english: I don't feel like eating right now.

23.speaker: PENGUIN
23.english: That would be a portable charcoal stove {\i1}(shichirin){\i0}.

26.speaker: PENGUIN
26.japanese: だから　僕は　失恋して ツッコむ気力もないの！
26.english: My heart is broken, so I don't have the energy to retort!

27.speaker: POLAR BEAR
27.japanese: ツッコんでるじゃない

28.speaker: PANDA
28.japanese: 失恋って　ペン子さん？
28.english: Did Miss Penko break your heart?

30.speaker: SASAKO
30.japanese: あ…　あの… なんて言ったらいいか…
30.english: Um, I don't know what to say.

31.speaker: PENGUIN
31.japanese: 何も言わないで　ほっておいてよ
31.english: Don't say anything. Just leave me alone.

32.speaker: POLAR BEAR
32.japanese: パンダくん駅前のベーグル屋さんおいしいらしいよ
32.english: I hear that the bagel shop in front of the station is pretty good, Panda. Really?

34.speaker: SASAKO
34.japanese: 聞いてほしいんですか？

35.speaker: PENGUIN
35.english: Of course! You'll feel better if you talk.

37.speaker: PENGUIN
37.japanese: って…　僕は 犯人じゃないから！
37.english: Hey! I'm not a criminal! So, what happened?

40.speaker: PENGUIN
40.english: Miss Penko was on a date. W-With who?

41.speaker: PENGUIN
41.japanese: それがなんと驚いたことに…

42.speaker: PENGUIN
42.japanese: 絶対に　ありえない相手で…
42.english: It's someone you'd never expect... Yes?

43.speaker: PENGUIN
43.english: I still can't believe it... Who was it?

44.speaker: PENGUIN
44.japanese: まさかと思うくらいの…

45.speaker: POLAR BEAR
45.japanese: いいから　早く吐け
45.english: Hurry up and spit it out!

46.speaker: PENGUIN
46.japanese: って…　僕　犯人じゃないから！
46.english: I told you, I'm not a criminal!

47.speaker: PENGUIN
47.japanese: さっき　公園で 目撃しちゃったんだ
47.english: I saw them earlier at the park. Oh!

48.speaker: PENGUIN
48.english: Miss Penko! What a chance encounter to see her here.

49.speaker: PENGUIN
49.japanese: 運命　感じちゃうな！

50.speaker: PENGUIN
50.japanese: やぁ！　偶然ですねペン…
50.english: Well, this is unexpected Miss— Sorry... to... keep... you... waiting. Well, let's go. Really? Mr. Tortoise? Wow, really?

52.speaker: PENGUIN
52.japanese: そう…　ペン子さんと待ち合わせて デートしてたんだ
52.english: That's right. They met up and went for a date.

53.speaker: PENKO
53.japanese: ステキなカフェですね

54.speaker: TORTOISE
54.japanese: 僕…　ここに 甲羅干しに来るんです～

60.speaker: PENGUIN
60.japanese: ２人で楽しそうにお茶飲んだり
60.english: They were totally enjoying having tea at the café,

61.speaker: PENGUIN
61.japanese: あ～んってしたり ボートに乗ってたんだよ！
61.english: and she was feeding him, and they were on a boat together!

62.speaker: POLAR BEAR
62.japanese: それ　どこで聞いてたの？
62.english: Where were you hearing all of this?

64.speaker: POLAR BEAR
64.japanese: なんだか涙ぐましいね

65.speaker: PANDA
65.japanese: でも　それだけじゃ
65.english: But I don't think any of those things mean they're going out.

66.speaker: PENGUIN
66.japanese: それが　決定的なことに…
66.english: But then something happened to make it official...

67.speaker: PENKO
67.japanese: 私…　大好きなんですよね

69.speaker: PENGUIN
69.japanese: 知らなかった…　ペン子さん カメが大好きだったなんて…
69.english: I had no idea that Miss Penko liked turtles.

70.speaker: PENGUIN
70.japanese: カメのどこがいいんだろう？

71.speaker: PENGUIN
71.japanese: ねぇどこがいいんだと思う？
71.english: I'm asking you, what's so good about them?

73.speaker: SASAKO
73.japanese: こ…　甲羅があるとこですかね？
73.english: M-Maybe because they have a shell?

74.speaker: POLAR BEAR
74.japanese: 首とか手足が引っ込むところも キュートかも
74.english: The fact that their head and legs scrunch in might be cute. It's amazing that they live for a thousand years.

75.speaker: PENGUIN
75.japanese: ペ…　ペンギンにだって いいとこあるでしょ？

77.speaker: PENGUIN
77.japanese: 負けてる…　完璧に負けてるよ

78.speaker: PENGUIN
78.japanese: 僕はどうして ペンギンに生まれたんだろう
78.english: Why was I born a penguin?

79.speaker: PENGUIN
79.japanese: お母さん！　どうして　僕を カメに生んでくれなかったの！？
79.english: Mom, why didn't you give birth to me as a turtle?

80.speaker: PANDA
80.japanese: ペンギンさん　あのね

81.speaker: PANDA
81.japanese: ペンギンからカメは生まれないんだよ
81.english: penguins don't give birth to turtles.

83.speaker: PENGUIN
83.japanese: あ～あ… こんなことなら思い切って
83.english: Aw man, if I knew this was going to happen...

84.speaker: PENGUIN
84.japanese: ペン子さんを ドライブに誘っとくんだった
84.english: I should have just asked Miss Penko out for a drive.

85.speaker: SASAKO
85.japanese: い…　今からでも遅くないですよ
85.english: I-I don't think it's too late. Huh?

86.speaker: POLAR BEAR
86.japanese: せっかく免許も取ったんだし…
86.english: You did just get your license...

88.speaker: PANDA
88.japanese: ペン子さんカメ好きなら
88.english: But if Miss Penko likes turtles, she might not like fast things.

89.speaker: PENGUIN
89.japanese: ゆっくりじゃないとダメなのか～！
89.english: So it has to be slow?!

91.speaker: PENGUIN
91.japanese: もう　きっぱり ペン子さんのことは諦めよう
91.english: I'm going to give up on Miss Penko completely.

92.speaker: SASAKO
92.english: That might be for the better. Yup. You'll find another nice girl.

93.speaker: PENGUIN
93.japanese: そうだよね　いつまでも 引きずってちゃダメだよね
93.english: You're right, I've got to move on. Yup.

95.speaker: PENGUIN
95.japanese: やっぱ　諦めちゃダメでしょ！
95.english: I shouldn't give up that easily!

97.speaker: SASAKO
97.japanese: でも　ペン子さんには　ゾウガメさんが…
97.english: But Miss Penko has Mr. Tortoise.

98.speaker: PENGUIN
98.japanese: ペンギンがゾウガメなんかに 負けてたまるか～っ！
98.english: There's no way I'm going to lose to a tortoise!

99.speaker: POLAR BEAR
99.japanese: あっ　ゾウガメさん

102.speaker: PANDA
102.japanese: ペン子さんの彼氏　来た

103.speaker: SASAKO
103.japanese: ダメだよ　そんなこと言っちゃ

104.speaker: PANDA
104.english: Are you going to duel now?

106.speaker: PANDA
106.japanese: えっと　こういうのたしか…
106.english: Um, I think they call this shabadaba.

107.speaker: SASAKO
107.english: You mean a clash of titans {\i1}(shuraba){\i0}.

108.speaker: PENGUIN
108.english: Hey, shut up for a second!

109.speaker: PENGUIN
109.japanese: とにかく　ペン子さんと どういうおつきあいなのか
109.english: Anyways, I have to find out what he's doing with

110.english: Miss Penko once and for all.

114.speaker: PANDA
114.japanese: ペンギンさん　はっきりさせるんじゃ なかったの？
114.english: Weren't you going to find out what he's doing, Mr. Penguin?

117.speaker: PENGUIN
117.japanese: あ…　いや…　あのさ！ この間さ　公園で…
117.english: Um, well... I-I was wondering, at the park the other day... I ate a really delicious sardine.

120.speaker: PENGUIN
120.english: I know that! There's a certain order in conversations!

121.speaker: PENGUIN
121.japanese: そういえば　あの公園でさ
121.english: Oh yeah, at the park, you were with a girl penguin, right?

122.speaker: PENGUIN
122.japanese: あの公園　気持いいよね

123.speaker: POLAR BEAR
123.japanese: で　ゾウガメさんとペン子さんは どういう関係？
123.english: So, what's the relationship between you and Miss Penko, Mr. Tortoise?

124.speaker: PENGUIN
124.japanese: あからさまに聞かないでよ！
124.english: Don't be so blunt about it!

125.speaker: SASAKO
125.japanese: それで　ゾウガメさんは どうして一緒に？
125.english: So why were you two together? You, too, Miss Sasako?!

126.speaker: PANDA
126.japanese: なんで　公園に一緒にいたの？
126.english: Why were you two together at the park?

127.speaker: TORTOISE
127.english: I was... invited... Miss Penko invited you?

130.speaker: PENGUIN
130.japanese: ゾウガメさん　ペン子さんとお幸せに！ うわ～ん！
130.english: May you two live happily together!

132.speaker: PENGUIN
132.english: Wait a second. If Miss Penko likes turtles so much...

135.speaker: POLAR BEAR
135.japanese: 何やってるの　ペンギンさん
135.english: What are you doing, Mr. Penguin? Where did you get that shell?

137.speaker: PENGUIN
137.japanese: ペン子さんはカメが大好き

138.speaker: POLAR BEAR
138.japanese: ああ　ペン子さんはね
138.english: Oh, about that... What Miss Penko really likes are cameras, not turtles (kame). Huh?

139.speaker: POLAR BEAR
139.japanese: 最近　カメラが趣味らしいよ
139.english: Apparently she's really into cameras as of late.

140.speaker: SASAKO
140.japanese: ゾウガメさんも同じ趣味みたいで
140.english: Mr. Tortoise apparently has the same hobby.

141.speaker: PANDA
141.japanese: 大好きなのはね　カメじゃなくてカメラだよ
141.english: What she really likes are cameras, not turtles.

143.speaker: SASAKO
143.english: Thanks for all of your hard work.

145.speaker: POLAR BEAR
145.japanese: パンダくん　閉店なんだけど
145.english: We're closed now, Panda. Panda? Oh, good morning.

148.speaker: GRIZZLY
148.japanese: よう　ちょっと遊びに行こうぜ
148.english: Hey, let's go play for a bit.

152.speaker: GRIZZLY
152.japanese: ガキの行くところじゃねぇんだよ
152.english: We ain't goin' anywhere for kids.

153.speaker: GRIZZLY
153.english: This is an adult's night out.

155.speaker: PANDA
155.japanese: なんか　すごくおもしろそう

156.speaker: GRIZZLY
156.japanese: 何でついてくるんだよ
156.english: Why the hell are you tagging along?

157.speaker: POLAR BEAR
157.japanese: グリズリーくんが　誘ったんじゃない

161.speaker: POLAR BEAR
161.japanese: というわけで　パンダくん

162.speaker: POLAR BEAR
162.japanese: 今日は残念だけど中止だから帰ろう
162.english: I regret to inform you, tonight's plans have been canceled and we're going home.

164.speaker: GRIZZLY
164.english: How the hell did it come to that?! Wait a minute!

166.speaker: GRIZZLY
166.japanese: 行くに決まってんだろ！

168.speaker: POLAR BEAR
168.japanese: バッティングセンター

170.speaker: GRIZZLY
170.english: What the hell are you doing?! This isn't a place you're supposed to be climbing around! Really?

173.speaker: GRIZZLY
173.japanese: だから　そうじゃねぇんだよ
173.english: That's not what those are used for.

174.speaker: POLAR BEAR
174.japanese: 結構　凝りがほぐれるね
174.english: This does work quite well to relieve tension.

175.speaker: GRIZZLY
175.japanese: お前までやってんじゃねぇ！
175.english: What the hell are you doing it for, too?!

176.speaker: PANDA
176.japanese: じゃあ　ここで何して遊ぶの？
176.english: So what are we supposed to do here?

177.speaker: GRIZZLY
177.japanese: 向こうから来た球を 打ち返すんだよ
177.english: You hit the ball that comes at you.

179.speaker: POLAR BEAR
179.english: Nice catch! You're amazing, Polar Bear!

180.speaker: POLAR BEAR
180.japanese: ピッチャーライナーだね
180.english: It was a line drive at the pitcher.

181.english: What the hell are you doing?!

183.speaker: GRIZZLY
183.japanese: やらなくていいんだよ！

185.speaker: PANDA
185.japanese: グリズリーさんやったね！
185.english: You did it, Mr. Grizzly! I don't feel like doing this anymore.

186.speaker: POLAR BEAR
186.english: Then I'll show you how it's done.

188.speaker: GRIZZLY
188.japanese: バット　持ちすぎだろう！

189.speaker: POLAR BEAR
189.japanese: じゃあ　改めてお手本を

191.speaker: GRIZZLY
191.japanese: もう　いい… パンダ　とにかく　やってみろ
191.english: Enough. Just try it, Panda. Raise your bat and watch the ball carefully, Panda. Okay!

192.speaker: GRIZZLY
192.japanese: いや　そうじゃなくてな…

193.speaker: POLAR BEAR
193.japanese: ボールを　しっかり見て

198.speaker: GRIZZLY
198.japanese: やっぱりじゃねぇ！ バットで当てろ！！
198.english: Not "I thought so." Hit the damn ball with the bat!

203.speaker: PANDA
203.japanese: ああ　おもしろかった

204.speaker: GRIZZLY
204.japanese: 全然　バッティングしてねぇけどな
204.english: You didn't bat at all, though.

205.speaker: GRIZZLY
205.english: We're going to the next place. We're going somewhere else?

206.speaker: GRIZZLY
206.japanese: 夜はこれからだからな

208.speaker: PANDA
208.english: I wonder where we're going next!

209.speaker: GRIZZLY
209.english: We're going to take a bath!

215.speaker: GRIZZLY
215.japanese: そういう　すげぇじゃ ねぇんだけどな…

217.speaker: GRIZZLY
217.japanese: まずはちゃんと体洗えよ
217.english: First you have to wash your body thoroughly. Okay.

218.speaker: BOY
218.japanese: 背中　流してあげようか？
218.english: Do you want me to wash your back?

220.speaker: PANDA
220.japanese: 背中　流してあげようか？
220.english: Do you want me to wash your back? That's thoughtful of you! Hey! Stop that! It tickles for some reason. Really?

221.speaker: POLAR BEAR
221.japanese: パンダくん もっと強くこするんだよ
221.english: You have to scrub harder, Panda.

222.speaker: GRIZZLY
222.japanese: イテーッ！！　ツメ　立てんな　ツメ！
222.english: Ow! Don't use your damn nails!

225.speaker: GRIZZLY
225.english: Hurry up and rinse it off.

228.speaker: PANDA
228.japanese: グリズリーさんも流してあげるよ
228.english: I'll rinse you off, too, Mr. Grizzly.

230.speaker: GRIZZLY
230.japanese: アチーッ！！　熱いじゃねえか！
230.english: Ow, that's hot! What the hell?! That's really hot! I'm sorry.

231.speaker: GRIZZLY
231.japanese: 赤いほうを回すとお湯で
231.english: Turn the red knob for hot water.

232.speaker: GRIZZLY
232.japanese: 青いほうが水だからな
232.english: The blue knob is for cold water.

234.speaker: GRIZZLY
234.japanese: 冷てぇ！！　ちゃんと調節しろよ！
234.english: That's cold! Control the damn temperature better!

240.speaker: GRIZZLY
240.japanese: パンダ…　もういい　気持だけ　もらっとく
240.english: That's enough, Panda.  I appreciate your effort.

241.speaker: PANDA
241.japanese: いいニオイになったね

242.speaker: GRIZZLY
242.japanese: 何の香りだ？　ここのシャンプー
242.english: What scent is this shampoo? It smells really delicious. It's this.

243.speaker: POLAR BEAR
243.japanese: クマザサシャンプーだね

244.speaker: PANDA
244.english: I wonder if you can drink it.

246.speaker: POLAR BEAR
246.japanese: というわけで　パンダくん お風呂に入れてみよう
246.english: Well then, let's try putting it in the bath, Panda.

248.speaker: GRIZZLY
248.english: No, it's not. Don't do it. Look at it fly!

249.speaker: GRANDPA
249.japanese: そうそう　うまい　うまい

250.speaker: PANDA
250.english: How do you do that? Like this.

253.speaker: PANDA
253.english: Where are you going? I like the sauna.

257.speaker: PANDA
257.english: What's a sauna? I'm sweating a lot for some reason.

258.speaker: GRIZZLY
258.japanese: それがサウナのいいところだ
258.english: That's the good thing about saunas.

259.speaker: PANDA
259.english: I feel like I'm being steamed.

260.speaker: GRIZZLY
260.japanese: これが体にいいんだよ！
260.english: That's what's great for your body.

263.speaker: PANDA
263.english: Me, too. I can't do it...

265.speaker: GRIZZLY
265.japanese: 今日は　やけに 時間が長く感じるぜ
265.english: Time feels like it's passing really slow today.

270.speaker: PANDA
270.japanese: 夜遊びって　おもしろいね
270.english: Having a night out is fun!

271.speaker: GRIZZLY
271.japanese: 小腹も空いたし ちょっと一杯やってくか
271.english: I'm a bit hungry, so let's go have a drink.

274.speaker: GUY
274.english: Hey, there! You got a new guy with ya today.

275.speaker: GRIZZLY
275.japanese: 親父　とりあえず　生２つ
275.english: Let's start with two draft beers, pops.

276.speaker: PANDA
276.japanese: あとアイスコーヒーください

277.speaker: GRIZZLY
277.japanese: カフェじゃねぇんだぞ

282.speaker: PANDA
282.english: Having a night out is great.

284.speaker: GRIZZLY
284.japanese: 人生はな 昼もあれば夜もある
284.english: If life has days, it also has nights.

285.speaker: GRIZZLY
285.japanese: 明るいときもあれば 暗いときもある
285.english: If there's light, there's dark, too.

286.speaker: GRIZZLY
286.japanese: 暗いときにも楽しいことはたくさんあるんだよ
286.english: There're plenty of fun things to do in the dark.

287.speaker: POLAR BEAR
287.japanese: どっちもあるから いいんだよね
287.english: It's nice because you have either option.

290.speaker: PANDA
290.japanese: パンダも白いとこと黒いとこ　両方あるからいいんだもんね
290.english: Pandas are great because they're both black and white.

291.speaker: GRIZZLY
291.japanese: おお　そうだな！ そのとおりだ！
291.english: That's right. Exactly. You've got a point.

294.speaker: POLAR BEAR
294.japanese: すっかり寝ちゃったね　パンダくん

295.speaker: GRIZZLY
295.japanese: なんで俺がコイツをおぶって 帰んなきゃなんねぇんだよ
295.english: Why the hell am I the one that has to carry him back?

297.speaker: POLAR BEAR
297.english: He said he had fun. Jeez.

298.speaker: GRIZZLY
298.japanese: まっ　また連れてきてやっても いいかな
298.english: Well, I guess I don't mind if we bring him along again.

299.speaker: PANDA
299.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

300.speaker: PENGUIN
300.english: What is it, Panda? Tell us about a time you thought you were cool. Well, let's see...

301.speaker: PANDA
301.english: Don't worry if you don't have one. You're not even giving me two seconds to think about this, are you?

302.speaker: PANDA
302.english: Don't worry if you don't have one.

303.speaker: PENGUIN
303.english: I wanted to think of one...

304.speaker: PANDA
304.english: Don't worry if you don't have one.

305.speaker: PENGUIN
305.english: It's up to you, Polar Bear.

306.speaker: POLAR BEAR
306.japanese: 次回　しろくまカフェ

307.speaker: POLAR BEAR
307.japanese: 生放送でお送りします
307.english: will be brought to you live.

308.speaker: PENGUIN
308.english: We're going to do it normally.
